Boulders.Name: Power Glide Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies just uphill from the trail.

Routes.Name: Power Glide (aka Snot Here)
Routes.Description: Start at the left edge of the boulder, traverse the slopey rail, reach up for the slot, use this to gain the crimp and make a big move for the jug.

Routes.Name: Standard Route
Routes.Description: Start with hands matched on a good hold in the horizontal crack and move up to small crimps then top out.

Boulders.Name: Split Rock
Boulders.Description: This easily identifiable boulder is just uphill from Power Glide and is split in two at an easy chimney.

Routes.Name: Dark Side of the Moon
Routes.Description: Start low and head up the left side then traverse over (crux) and finish up the right arete as with Vaino Problem.

Routes.Name: Vaino Problem
Routes.Description: Start with a right hand on the left arete and a poor left-hand sloper. Continue up the arete.

Routes.Name: Johnson Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the right arete

Routes.Name: Johnson Problem
Routes.Description: Start left hand on a large rounded side pull and right hand on a small right facing crimp. Climb up to a huge jug and over the bulge to the top.

Boulders.Name: Spiral Boulder
Boulders.Description: The Huge boulder uphill from the trail slighly South of Split Rock.

Routes.Name: Borealis
Routes.Description: Start near the beginning of Spiral Traverse and climb the face above a sketchy landing.

Routes.Name: Spiral Traverse
Routes.Description: The classic traverse on the North side of the boulder goes left to right.

Routes.Name: Spiral Direct
Routes.Description: Start on small udges, use an undercling to gain a pocket, then the juggy hueco at the top.

Boulders.Name: Couinard's Slab Boulder
Boulders.Description: A small boulder just uphill from the Spiral boulder with an obvious slab problem.

Routes.Name: Chouinard's Slab
Routes.Description: Climb the easy slab.

Boulders.Name: Slap Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious small chalked boulder just North of Spiral Traverse.

Routes.Name: Slap
Routes.Description: Climb the lowball face.

Boulders.Name: Mommy's Boys
Boulders.Description: Tall boulder with some nice easy topropes/highballs.

Routes.Name: Mommy's Boy Left
Routes.Description: Climb the left side of the face via a flake, move right and top out.

Routes.Name: Mommy's Boy Center
Routes.Description: Climb the center of the face on small edges.

Routes.Name: Mommy's Boy Right
Routes.Description: Climb the right side of the face via a tricky start and a crux mantle.

Boulders.Name: Boulder Opposite Mommy's Boys
Boulders.Description: The boulder on the other side of the corridor.

Routes.Name: Yabo Dyno
Routes.Description: Start low on decent edges and move right to a dyno from a sidepull and a small edge to a rounded hold. Located directly across from Mommy's Boys. Located on the opposite side of the boulder from Mommy's Boys.

Routes.Name: Pocket Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse from left to right on bad feet to a cruxy sequence moving right then up to a ledgy rail. On the opposite side of the boulder form Mommy's Boys.

Boulders.Name: Ummagumma Boulder
Boulders.Description: A Large boulder that appears when the trail begins to flatten out.

Routes.Name: Ummagumma
Routes.Description: Start form the large hueco, fire to another, distant, hueco, then top out somehow.

Boulders.Name: Boulder Behind Ummagumma
Boulders.Description: This is the boulder directly behind the Ummagumma boulder.

Routes.Name: Fighting with Alligators
Routes.Description: Sit start and climb up and right through the prow and then along the lip of the boulder. Pull over the jug midway in the face.

Routes.Name: Rodeo Style
Routes.Description: A direct start below the finishing jug of Fighting with Alligators.

Boulders.Name: Boulder
Boulders.Description: To the right (North) of the trail just downhill from Ummagumma.

Routes.Name: Face Problem
Routes.Description: Start on edgges and climb through the hueco. A harder sit start is possible

Boulders.Name: Boulder 1
Boulders.Description: This is the obvious large boulder.

Routes.Name: West Arete
Routes.Description: Cimb up the west arete via ledges, sidepulls and pockets.

Routes.Name: Nylon Boy
Routes.Description: Just left of Boot Flake, climb up to a sidepull then to the top.

Routes.Name: Boot Flake
Routes.Description: Start slightly to the right of the "boot". Gain a right hand crimp and make a big move to the boot. Carefully top out.

Routes.Name: Endo Boy
Routes.Description: This line climbs to the right of Boot Flake via sidepulls and crimps.

Routes.Name: Bob Kamps Face
Routes.Description: Climb the easy face right of Endo Boy.

Routes.Name: Three Pigs
Routes.Description: Climb the pin scars on the east side of the boulder. Avoiding the scars is a grade or two harder.

Routes.Name: Undercling Problem
Routes.Description: Start at the flake and move into the undercling with slippery feet. Reach over the top for a chipped hold and top out.

Boulders.Name: Slant Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder is a few yards to the southeast of Boulder 1 and has a low angle west face that is often ascended with no hands.

Routes.Name: The Edge
Routes.Description: Climb the very easy west arete.

Routes.Name: Slant Rock Face Right
Routes.Description: Climb the face just left of the edge.

Routes.Name: Slant Rock Face Center
Routes.Description: Climb the center of the face using friction and small crimps.

Routes.Name: Slant Rock Face Left
Routes.Description: Climb the left side of the face.

Routes.Name: Slant Flake
Routes.Description: Sit start and climb the juggy seam up and left to the mantle topout.

Boulders.Name: Pump Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies just north of Boulder 1 and has a traverse around its lip

Routes.Name: Pump Traverse
Routes.Description: Stand start at the south-east corner and traverse the        lip of the bouler to the north-west corner and top out. The sit start at the south-east corner is V1 and the sit start at he south-west corner is V2.

Routes.Name: Pump Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the north-east arete via a sit start.

Routes.Name: North Face Pump Rock
Routes.Description: Climb Straight up the face and mantle.

Boulders.Name: Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder directly behind Pump Rock.

Routes.Name: West Face
Routes.Description: Start on sidepulls and cimb up to the sloping arete and mantle. Directly behind Pump Rock.

Boulders.Name: Cranking Queenie Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder is adjacent to the north of Pump Boulder and has a very overhanging north face through the cave.

Routes.Name: Jam Crack
Routes.Description: Climb the crack on the North side of the boulder.

Routes.Name: Cranking Queenie
Routes.Description: Sit start and climb up on manufactured holds. Top out direct (bold) or left.

Routes.Name: Aftershock
Routes.Description: Start with the right hand on a good edge and jump for the left leaning rail and top out.

Boulders.Name: Say Goodnight Boulder
Boulders.Description: Small boulder just east of Pump Rock has 1 problem facing Pump Rock.

Routes.Name: Say Goodnight
Routes.Description: Start with left hand on a sharp sloper and right on a small crimp. Climb up and slightly left to top, right arete is off.

Boulders.Name: Pile Ups Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious short boulder next to the trail.

Routes.Name: Pile Ups Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the lip of the boulder left-to-right.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver
Routes.Description: Start at the flake-jug thingy, make a big move up to a sloping crimp and top out via a dyno for the lip or static moves out left.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver Lieback
Routes.Description: Start matched on a good crimp, reach left for the lieback hold, pop for the sloping shelf and make a big move to top out at the apex of the boulder.

Routes.Name: Gomer Pile
Routes.Description: Ascend the face to the right of Pile Driver Lieback.

Routes.Name: Anderson Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the face on bad holds left to right starting at the starting hold of Pile Driver.

Boulders.Name: Adam's Rib Boulder
Boulders.Description: Nice boulder with a couple problems close to camp.

Routes.Name: Adam's Rib Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the left arete rail. Top out in the center of the boulder, or for a little more spice, top out to the left (through the tree branch). There is a sharp yucca in the landing zone.

Boulders.Name: Rythym and the Heat Boulder
Boulders.Description: The suspended block on the way to Teflon President

Routes.Name: Rhythym and the Heat
Routes.Description: Climb the suspended block straight up. It is a bit dirty these days but with more trafiic would clean up to a decent problem.

Boulders.Name: Teflon President Boulder
Boulders.Description: The big boulder with ther arete on the southwest side.

Routes.Name: Teflon President
Routes.Description: Climb the right arete and top out at the apex of the boulder.

Routes.Name: Not Teflon President
Routes.Description: Climb the left arete.

Boulders.Name: Teflon Arete Boulder
Boulders.Description: Tall boulder up the hill from Teflon Boulder.

Routes.Name: Teflon Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the beautiful arete. A nice foot gets you started. Downclimb slab off the back of the boulder.

Boulders.Name: Mr Ed. Boulder
Boulders.Description: A large clump of boulders about 30 yards south of the trail. You see an obvoius crack/chute when approaching it.

Routes.Name: Talk Dirty to Me
Routes.Description: Climb the rouded arete.

Routes.Name: Slept Together
Routes.Description: Climb the face left of Mr. Ed

Routes.Name: Mr. Ed
Routes.Description: Climb the lieback crack on the north face. Often toproped.

Routes.Name: Ionizer
Routes.Description: Climb the tall face right of Mr. Ed using tiny edges, often toproped.

Routes.Name: Ed's Route
Routes.Description: Climb the face to the right of Ionizer.

Boulders.Name: Credit Card Lover Boulder
Boulders.Description: The Boulder left of Mr. Ed boulder with a left-facing flake on it, usually toproped

Routes.Name: Regular Route
Routes.Description: Climb the left side of the slabby face, often toproped.

Routes.Name: Horse Farts
Routes.Description: Slabby face left of Credit Card Lover, often toproped

Routes.Name: Credit Card Lover
Routes.Description: Climb the left-facing flake.

Routes.Name: Do Me
Routes.Description: Climb the face right of the flake on Credit card Lover, often toproped.

Routes.Name: Easy Face
Routes.Description: Climb the easy face around the corner to the right of Do Me.

Boulders.Name: Holy Water Boulder
Boulders.Description: This small boulder is located somewhat by itself before you reach the main part of the Main Area. It is to the left of the trail, directly bordering the trail.

Routes.Name: And the Son
Routes.Description: Sit Start at a hole and climb straight up using a shallow crack.

Routes.Name: In the Name of the Father
Routes.Description: Climb the obvious large pockets facing the trail in the direction to the campground. Top out on large flakes.

Routes.Name: And the Holy Spirit, Amen
Routes.Description: On the side facing the trail, sit start on crips, climb to the large pocket and top out.

Boulders.Name: Alfa Boulder
Boulders.Description: The first boulder on the right after the Holy Water boulder with an overhanging prow.

Routes.Name: Unknown
Routes.Description: Sit start on crimps and climb over the roof/prow.

Boulders.Name: Arbor Day Boulder
Boulders.Description: The large boulder just up the trail from the Alfa Boulder

Routes.Name: Better Bold than Old
Routes.Description: Start sitting, on the lowest holds possible with a good left foot and go up and slightly left at first then straight up finishing with good holds and the lip. Amazing rock quality and good movement.

Routes.Name: Arbor Days
Routes.Description: Start on the obvious holds at face height and go up and slightly left on good crimps.

Boulders.Name: B1 Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious chalked boulder right next to the trail.

Routes.Name: B1 Traverse
Routes.Description: Start on a set of plates on the right side of the boulder, traverse along the lip to the patina plates on the left and climb along the pates to the top.

Routes.Name: Thin Face
Routes.Description: Climb a series of nice crimps with the smallest one just before the top.

Boulders.Name: Blank Generation Boulder
Boulders.Description: The large squat boulder behind the B1 boulder

Routes.Name: Freeway Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the lip of the boulder starting on the downhill corner across from Sword of Damocles

Routes.Name: The Wave
Routes.Description: Start low and right, climb the face then reach for a jug at the lip of the roof and mantle over. A good spot rpotects from the rock behind you.

Routes.Name: Blank Generation
Routes.Description: Start on bad crimps on glued-on flake, then boost out huge to high crimps, hit the lip and top-out. The sit start is V10.

Routes.Name: Crooked I
Routes.Description: Start with both hands on a decent crimp and climb up via a right-facing sloper to a hard finish.

Boulders.Name: Victory Boulder
Boulders.Description: Unique wedged boulder near Blank Generation.

Routes.Name: Victory Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the right arÃªte and face.

Boulders.Name: Eriksson Boulder
Boulders.Description: Across from the Sword of Damocles Boulder

Routes.Name: Eriksson Problem
Routes.Description: Climb crystals and tiny crimps up the tallish face facing Sword of Damocles.

Boulders.Name: Orange Flambe Boulder
Boulders.Description: In between the refrigerator and the fang, the large orange boulder perched on the granite slab.

Routes.Name: Orange Flambe
Routes.Description: Start hugging the Orange Patina with a good right hand sidepull and mediocre left hand sidepull. Use technique and a bit of wizardry to climb up and slightly right on holds you wish were better. A Horse Flats classic.

Boulders.Name: Swiss Cheese Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder right next to the trail with the overhanging huecoed downhill face.

Routes.Name: Swiss Cheese
Routes.Description: Climb the overhanging huecoed face on the downhill side of the boulder. The original finish stays left, but it is slightly easier to finish right, although the landing is worse.

Routes.Name: Passat
Routes.Description: Pad stack or hop up to the jug rail at about 8/9 feet, use small feet and some technique to gain the patina up and right. Landing is fairly narrow so a spotter would be helpful.

Boulders.Name: Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder sits across the trail and just uphill from the Swiss Cheese Boulder. It has a slabby face facing the trail and a clean vertical face on the left side.

Routes.Name: Heady Topper
Routes.Description: Located on the slabby side of the boulder facing the trail. Mantle onto the knob then acsend the tall slab above.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb the right side of the clean vertical face on positive crimps and knobs. Beautiful rock.

Boulders.Name: The Faclon Boulder
Boulders.Description: A short boulder just to the east of Blank Generation.

Routes.Name: The Falcon
Routes.Description: Start on low rail, heel-hook and go for a hold out right, reach up for the sidepull and try to top out. Short but burly

Boulders.Name: Pumpernickel Boulder
Boulders.Description: A long short boulder with a nice traverse on good rock.

Routes.Name: Pumpernickel
Routes.Description: A long pumpy traverse on mostly good holds and good rock. Start low and left and traverse all the way right until you can follow the holds up and to the top of the boulder.

Boulders.Name: Thin Crack Boulder
Boulders.Description: A tall boulder with an obvious crack, slightly off the trail to the left of the B1 Traverse boulder.

Routes.Name: Thin Crack
Routes.Description: The obvious crack visible from the trail

Boulders.Name: X2 Boulder
Boulders.Description: Boulder just east of the Barndoor Arete.

Routes.Name: Your Everyday Junglist
Routes.Description: Start at high underclings and make a few harder moves up and left to the lip. Can be done from a sit down and right at about V6.

Boulders.Name: Barndoor Arete Boulder
Boulders.Description: Boulder with the obvious arete between the Fang and The Great Circle

Routes.Name: Barndoor Arete
Routes.Description: Ascend the obvious technical arete to better holds

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Easy short crack left of Barndoor arete.

Boulders.Name: Sword of Damocles Boulder
Boulders.Description: A tall boulder with an overhanging arete on the downhill side, in the middle of the main area, to the left of the Eriksson problem, looking uphill.

Routes.Name: Sword of Damocles
Routes.Description: Climb the improbable-looking tall arete on the right side of the downhill face. One of the best problems in Southern California.

Boulders.Name: Golf Boulder
Boulders.Description: Boulder just uphill from Sword of Damocles

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb the arete on sharp holds.

Routes.Name: The Hotel
Routes.Description: Start with both hands matched on the underclings, make some moves up and right to crimps and slopes.

Boulders.Name: The Fang Boulder
Boulders.Description: A boulder with a severly overhanging huecoed face just off the trail to the right just past the 5.7 Crack.

Routes.Name: The Fang
Routes.Description: Start under the roof and climb the fang. The sit start is V5.

Routes.Name: Zack's Roof
Routes.Description: Start as for The Fang, but climb the huecos out right.

Boulders.Name: Victor Boulder
Boulders.Description: A boulder between the B1 Boulder and The Great Curve with a steep clab facing the trail.

Routes.Name: Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the chunky arete on the downhill side of the boulder. Bad landing.

Routes.Name: Slab
Routes.Description: Climb the slab without using the arete, slightly harder to the left.

Boulders.Name: Great Curve Boulder
Boulders.Description: The big boulder with a blunt arete on the left, about 30 yards left of the B1 boulder.

Routes.Name: The Great Curve
Routes.Description: Jump start to a pinch on the blunt left arete, and climb the arete to a sketchy top out.

Boulders.Name: Skin Boulder
Boulders.Description: Southern exposed granite boulder known for the area classic Bow Sprits. Just south of the Main trail.

Routes.Name: The Transom
Routes.Description: Climb the sharp left-hand arete of the Skin boulder via a painful start and easier climbing above.

Routes.Name: Mr Skin
Routes.Description: Ascend the blank face between The Transom and Bowsprits. I have never heard of this actually being done, it looks impossible.

Routes.Name: Bowsprits
Routes.Description: Clinb the right-hand arete up beautiful orange rock with great movement to a juggy finish.

Boulders.Name: Peanut Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder is straight downhill from the obvious Y-Crack past the Skin Boulder. It is visible from the trail.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: On the undercut face facing Mr Skin, climb the pockets.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: On the left side of the boulder, when facing the boulder from the main trail, start near a small, sharp tree stump. The true sit start is perhaps v4.

Routes.Name: Nothing But Sunshine
Routes.Description: Start both hands in the diagonal jug, go right hand up to the crimp, then traverse left on crimps and pinches to a big throw to a good crimp out left and up to good patina up top. One of the best at The Flats.

Routes.Name: The Peanut
Routes.Description: Start in the same diagonal jug as NBS, but instead go left hand up to the crimp, then right hand to a slick side pull and a big crux throw up left to patina.

Routes.Name: Daddy Long Legs
Routes.Description: Right of the Peanut, in the center of the face, start on two good crimps and climb straight up.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb patina crimps on the right side of the face away from the trail.

Boulders.Name: Y Crack Boulder
Boulders.Description: Obvious boulder with a Y - shaped crack on the right side of the trail.

Routes.Name: Fish Arete
Routes.Description: Tall arete just left of Y-crack.

Routes.Name: Y Crack
Routes.Description: The highball Y crack with a sketchy landing. Usually TRd back in the day.

Boulders.Name: Dragon Rock
Boulders.Description: Beautiful, secluded, 35'+ southern exposed granite boulder.

Routes.Name: Dragon Flake
Routes.Description: Start just right of Dragon Flake, go straight up to the finish.

Routes.Name: Dragon Flake Cheater Variation
Routes.Description: Follow the flake up and right and around the arete.

Boulders.Name: unk Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder next to Dragon Flake

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Left hand on the arete, right hand on the lower sidepull to start. Get on to the slab and go up.

Routes.Name: Snowflake aka Schindler's Twist
Routes.Description: Start far right on a couple of great holds. Move left using underclings and tiny ledge feet. Get a hand around the arete, use some tricky foot work to get matched on the arete. High left foot and rock over, continue up the center of the slab, avoid the arete on the right.

Boulders.Name: Trailside Crack Boulder
Boulders.Description: Just upt the trail from the main area, boulder with an obvious low angle crack right off the trail.

Routes.Name: Trailside Crack
Routes.Description: Climb the obvious low angle crack.

Boulders.Name: Refigerator Boulder
Boulders.Description: Follow the main trail toward The Fang, heading left once you are below an obvious crack (5.7) on your righthand side. Once you head left you will see the boulder which has a large and obvious chalky rail about half way up the boulder.

Routes.Name: Defroster, aka The Freeze, aka The Fridge Door
Routes.Description: Sit down start with a nice low right side pull and a good left.

Routes.Name: The Refigerator
Routes.Description: Climb the facef from a high start.

Routes.Name: Opposition Movement
Routes.Description: Climb the seam in the corridor behing the Refigerator.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb jugs on the block at the back of the Opposition Movement corridor.

Boulders.Name: Parking Lot Rock
Boulders.Description: This large 10 - 20' high pile of boulders is the closet climbing to the Castle Rock official parking area.

Routes.Name: Yabo Roof
Routes.Description: Yabo cave heads out of a cave downgradient to the left about 15 feet from the highest point on the rock. The route heads out of the deep (approx. 6 feet) cave and up the huecos to a committing mantle finish.

Routes.Name: Tree Problem
Routes.Description: The Tree Problem sits on the uphill side of The Parking Lot Boulder, strangely enough no where near a tree. Climbing is sustained, and many approaches can get you through the problem depending on your height and finger size.

Routes.Name: Rug Head (AKA Rug Rat)
Routes.Description: Start with an undercling on a prow, then go straight up.

Routes.Name: Flakes
Routes.Description: Lieback the right facing flakes straight up.

Boulders.Name: Castle Rock
Boulders.Description: Castle Rock placeholder.

Routes.Name: Waimea Wall
Routes.Description: Reachy or dynamic face to ledge.

Boulders.Name: The Spoon
Boulders.Description: This small bouldering rock sits just downhill behind Castle Rock Proper. The top of the rock is shaped like an upside down spoon, and the rock itself looking at it across the gradient looks like a spoon.

Routes.Name: The Spoon
Routes.Description: The Spoon has one directive. How much can you scare yourself mantling 10 feet off the ground? Many a beached whale have been spotted here, as solid hands lead to highball sketchyness to pull you over the top.

Boulders.Name: Mr. Magoo Boulder
Boulders.Description: The Mr Magoo boulder at Castle Rock.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Starting in the small cave go for the pocket to your left. Getting your feet high and work your right hand up the arete until you hit the sweet spot (you will know it when you hit it) and top out.

Routes.Name: Warm Up
Routes.Description: Start just right of the flake and work your way right and up to the big pocket right above your head.

Routes.Name: Magoo Face
Routes.Description: Starts on the undercling and/or the flared crack on the side of the boulder facing Castle Rock proper. Make a balancy move up to the sloper over the bulge and finally to the large hueco.

Routes.Name: Bates Eliminate, Left
Routes.Description: Start with sloping crimps, bust a move up and left to the topout.

Routes.Name: Mr. Magoo
Routes.Description: Sit start on the two obvious hand holds. Throw high to a small shelf. Then head straight up to top out.

Boulders.Name: Mrs. Magoo Boulder
Boulders.Description: Mrs Magoo Boulder at Castle Rock.

Routes.Name: The Swim
Routes.Description: Start On horn, go up via some interesting moves into the mantle top out under the tree limb.

Boulders.Name: Dog Dish Boulders
Boulders.Description: The Dog Dish boulders at Castle Rock..

Routes.Name: The Warm Up
Routes.Description: Start low on the outcropping of Dog Dish Boulder towards Mr. Magoo. Work your way through balancy moves to the right (towards the low-down oblong hueco) and top out at the highpoint.

Routes.Name: Hueco Slap
Routes.Description: Start sitting with the big jug and slap out to the arete. Move up (staying on the same face) via a shallow pocket to the top.

Routes.Name: Hueco Wall
Routes.Description: Up the huecos on the downhill face of the lowest boulder in this area!

Boulders.Name: The Beak
Boulders.Description: This 12' - 18' boulder sits just south of Castle Rock proper, and holds bouldering problems suitable for warmups, and also for quite a challenge. Routes range from V0- to V6, on slabby to vertical faces.

Routes.Name: The Beak Traverse
Routes.Descripton: Left right traverse across the Beak formation ending in a V0 type mantle.

Boulders.Name: Bates Arete Boulder
Boulders.Description: From the Castle Rock parking lot, head uphill on the leftmost walking path 0.3 miles to Castle Rock proper. The walk wanders a bit, but the path is signed the whole way, so it's hard to miss. Once at Castle Rock proper (the big one, you can't miss it), walk around the right side of the rock to the smaller boulders slightly downhill ad left of the trail. This is the first boulder the trail will take you to if you walk downhill to the lower side of the rocks. The front face of The Spoon is just left of the trail about 5 feet, and the Bates Arete Boulder is about 60 feet further than the spoon across the gradient.

Routes.Name: Bates Arete
Routes.Description: The Bates Arete is one of the best problems of its grade in The Bay Area. Starting low on the right side of the rock, and about 25 feet long, first traversing up a steep overhang complete with large jugs and slopers leaving the desire for a good rest. The climb turns the corner from a good traverse into an uphill battle along a long solid arete where landings are bad. A final mantle, and the problem is yours.

Boulders.Name: Lost Keys Boulder
Boulders.Description: Lost Keys boulder.

Routes.Name: Lost Keys Traverse
Routes.Description: Super awesome traverse boulder problem!

Boulders.Name: Nature Nazi Boulder
Boulders.Description: Rad little area with some classics!

Routes.Name: Nature Nazi Traverse
Routes.Description: Starts low and to the left on the shortest part of the boulder, make your way rightward along the sloping lip, move through the insecure crux bulge and top out at some good jugs just before the large tree.

Routes.Name: Nature Nazi Arete
Routes.Description: First arete you see when you walk up.

Boulders.Name: Thee Classic
Boulders.Description: As you walk down the trail past the right side of Indian rock, this is the obvious line characterized by a large chalked up hueco in the middle. Pretty much directly under Donkey Dong.

Routes.Name: Thee Classic
Routes.Description: Move through the large hueco in the middle of the face, make a long move to the cryptic sloper at the lip and try to figure out how to top out.

Boulders.Name: Tom Peter's Slab
Boulders.Description: his large slabby wall is hidden from view as you hike up the trail but it is well worth searching out.

Routes.Name: The Pursuit of Wow
Routes.Description: Start up of the block onto the slab. Climb good pockets until the deep finger crack is reached. Follow this until its end then straight up to finish.

Boulders.Name: Grindrite Boulder
Boulders.Description: From the main trail look back right and you'll see the prominent prow taken by Grindrite.

Routes.Name: Grindrite
Routes.Description: Standing start at a good right hand hold. Pull up onto the rock into an immediately strenuous position. Make a few hard pulls up left then right to gain better holds and the spectacular horn like protrusion. Finish more easily up and left.

Boulders.Name: Slow Dance Cave
Boulders.Description: A cool, shady area with big overhanging boulders.

Routes.Name: Meth Squealer
Routes.Description: Sit start and climb the diagonal seam to slopers and finish up right.

Routes.Name: Weekender
Routes.Description: Start in the back of the 'Slowdance Cave', on the left side at good jugs. Traverse right on high jugs to a harder move into good right-slanting flake. Climb up the steep flake using good holds then straight up good jugs into alcove some 18 feet up. From the alcove, either top out straight up on very high jugs, or traverse off left above Rave.

Boulders.Name: Corner Boulder
Boulders.Description: A big intriguing boulder with two good highballs side-by-side on the west face.

Routes.Name: Corner Route
Routes.Description: Start on juggy flakes then climb the steep obtuse corner using finger-locks and edges. Finish in a bucket.

Routes.Name: The Tall Wall
Routes.Description: Start on the left-facing fin. Work up on good huecos to the heady crux top-out.

Boulders.Name: The Hard Crack
Boulders.Description: Along the cliffline right from Atari

Routes.Name: The Hard Crack
Routes.Description: Climb the splitter crack on ringlocks.

Boulders.Name: Slap Happy Boulder
Boulders.Description: This fun boulder hosts good moderates that live up to their 'slappy' name.

Routes.Name: Slap Happy
Routes.Description: Crouch start with difficulty and make a couple of hard pulls until good bucket holds above the overhang can be reached. From here finish easily above.

Boulders.Name: Black Magic Boulder
Boulders.Description: The tall dark South West face of this boulder will get most peoples palms sweating just looking at it. The rock on the smooth face is good quality, but due to the dark color it really heats up in the sun.

Routes.Name: Black Magic
Routes.Description: Climb directly up the middle of the tall slabby face until the break at 3/4 height. Take a breath and continue up passing a good pocket to the top.

Boulders.Name: Heavenly Path Boulder
Boulders.Description: The strikingly beautiful and tall boulder with the smooth and angular west face - home to the classic highball 'Heavenly Path' v1, as well as a handful of other quality highballs and warm-ups.

Routes.Name: Which Road
Routes.Description: Climb the face on good knobby holds.

Routes.Name: Heavenly Path
Routes.Description: Climb jugs to a large hueco/undercling. Pull onto the the slab for an exciting finish on crimps.

Routes.Name: Celestial Trail
Routes.Description: Start at a good sized hueco. Pull up and onto the slab and follow it, via nice slab moves, to the top. For the tick don't escape right onto the arete.

Boulders.Name: More Water, Less Power Boulder
Boulders.Description: This is the low boulder that splits the path, left of and very slightly up canyon from the tall brown slab of the Heavenly Path boulder.

Routes.Name: Hydra Pilferers
Routes.Description: Stand start and make a move up into the corner, which is finished direct.

Routes.Name: Any Which Way
Routes.Description: Sit start below the arete. Climb up left of the arete on good pockets until it is possible to move left along the arete before topping out.

Routes.Name: Comfort of Home
Routes.Description: Sit-start low with a left-hand pinch/sidepull and a right-hand sidepull under the short overhang. Move up on dishes and pockets slightly left, then work your way over the lip using the sloping arete (crux). Top-out on the easy, low-angle arete.

Routes.Name: Swing Your Partner
Routes.Description: Sit start at the as for Comfort of Home. Immediately pull up and right to gain the good flakes which are followed to the top.

Routes.Name: Grant's Christmas Present
Routes.Description: Sit start as for Happy Hooker. Make your way up and left across the overhanging face to finish up Swing Your Partner.

Routes.Name: Happy Hooker
Routes.Description: Sit-start on good holds and work up on jugs and an undercling to the jugs on the lip. Rock over the lip and top-out.

Boulders.Name: Solarium Boulder
Boulders.Description: A large attractive boulder with a gently overhanging, pocket-ridden west face.

Routes.Name: Solarium
Routes.Description: Just to the right of the arete, crouch-start on some big edges and head up and slightly right. Climb past a couple sets of thin pockets and make a toss for the lip.

Routes.Name: Western Round Up
Routes.Description: Climb up the wall on pockets with a tricky move to reach the slabby holds.

Boulders.Name: Happy Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies in the central canyon, 30 feet past the Solarium Boulder, dead ahead.

Routes.Name: The Hulk
Routes.Description: On the steep South face of the 'Happy Boulder', sit-start down and right on a juggy shelf. Steep moves lead to a left hand pinch and right hand sidepull/undercling. Make a big move up and left to the big block just below the lip (the "Boss" hold). From here, finish either up and left or up and right, same difficulty.

Routes.Name: Big Chicken
Routes.Description: On the steep South face of the 'Happy Boulder', sit-start on a juggy shelf (same starting holds as 'The Hulk'). Make a tricky sequence up and right onto the arete. Continue up the steep arete heading left on better holds to a few fun last moves.

Routes.Name: Big Chicken Stand
Routes.Description: Starting on opposing sidepulls climb trending left on the arete of the Happy Boulder.

Boulders.Name: Clapper Boulder
Boulders.Description: The Clapper Boulder contains the best problems in this area all over perfect flat landings.

Routes.Name: Not the Clapper
Routes.Description: Sit start with hand on good holds. Move up to the left trending rail and following it left and up. Make a hard move to gain hidden holds on the lip, and then continue directly to finish.

Boulders.Name: Every Color Boulder
Boulders.Description: A ship's prow of bullet-hard rock; steep on the downhill side, and just less than vertcal on the right.

Routes.Name: Every Color You Are
Routes.Description: Crouch start on the left side of the prow. Follow good finger pockets to a long move to gain a good hold above the lip. Match on this and traverse right passing a deep slot/crack. Continue right with a hard sequence of moves to pull up and right to gain the good deep flake. Finish direct.

Routes.Name: Mr. Witty
Routes.Description: Start with hands in good pockets. Rock up and over left with a tricky move to gain a thin flake for the left hand. Balance your way up the wall to gain the small slots. With fingers in the slots launch for the good lip.

Boulders.Name: Desert Skies
Boulders.Description: The wide undercut buttress with a line of pockets running along its base

Routes.Name: My Heart Grew Wings Under Desert Skies
Routes.Description: Start with pockets down low under the giant, obvious hueco. Use pockets and edges to make a couple stout moves to gain the jug in the giant hueco (crux). Move up on edges and jugs to the topout.

Boulders.Name: Serengeti Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies in the middle of the canyon, and can't be missed.

Routes.Name: Serengeti
Routes.Description: Start on the undercling/sidepull fin on the left side of the overhanging face. Move up and right on sloped dishes up to a move off a high left-hand crimp to a sloper (crux). Gain the 'Africa Flake' (jugs/rest) and find nice positive pockets and edges to the top as the angle eases off.

Routes.Name: The Flying Zebra
Routes.Description: A variation of Serengeti. Start on the undercling/sidepull fin on the left side of the face. This problem skips the crux crimps of Serengeti by traversing right into the pocket at the base of the Africa flake.

Boulders.Name: Soweto Boulder
Boulders.Description: From the Serengeti Boulder head up rightwards to reach this boulder.

Routes.Name: Burning Rubber Necklace
Routes.Description: A nice low traverse. Start low on the funky jugs on the right side of the small cave. Traverse left on good slopers and jugs staying low, making a couple cruxy moves with a crimp and good footwork, then head up and left to the big shelf.

Boulders.Name: Fred Boulder
Boulders.Description: Although small the Fred Boulder packs in some nice problems.

Routes.Name: Carrot Top
Routes.Description: Start at the same good flake as Sucker Punch. Traverse right on good incuts until possible to move up the blunt arete. Make hard moves to top out the arete.

Boulders.Name: Savannah Boulder
Boulders.Description: The first large, obvious boulder on the right.

Routes.Name: Ketron Classic
Routes.Description: Start low on sidepulls, do a move or two up to the left-hand undercling and make a big stretch to a big right-hand sloper. From here use either the intermediate left-hand crimp, or dyno for the bucket with your left hand (crux). Top out with jugs.

Boulders.Name: Sixty Foot Woman Wall
Boulders.Description: An extremely pocketed wall on the east rim.

Routes.Name: Sixty Foot Woman Traverse
Routes.Description: A left to right traverse of the wall.

Boulders.Name: Shadow Play Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder has a number of great moderate and easy problems with a choice of climbing in and out of the sun. The easier problems are poised above the canyon giving them an high up feeling, whilst the others are mainly steep and short in a cooler cave.

Routes.Name: Spinal Snap
Routes.Description: Sit start at the large undercling and move up with big moves on great holds. Move slightly right and then up and right to finish.

Routes.Name: Cue Ball
Routes.Description: Sit start at the good pocket in the middle of the cave. Pull out right and then up to the arete via a pocket which you think should be much better than it feels.With right hand on the arete launch up and left to either the top jug or a side pull then the top jug.

Boulders.Name: Secret Arete Boulder
Boulders.Description: The Secret Arete boulder is tucked away on the rim of the canyon just east of Shadow Play.

Routes.Name: Rio's Secret Arete
Routes.Description: In the chimney to the right of the prominent arete you will find the "secret arete". Climb the balancy arete. Optional sit start at the same grade.

Boulders.Name: Slight Inducement Boulder
Boulders.Description: The main boulder in this area has a fine collection of easy problems all of which face west. The problems range from steep on huge holds to vertical on smaller holds.

Routes.Name: Slight Inducement
Routes.Description: Sit start at the good hold. Climb up the steep arete on excellent holds.

Boulders.Name: Maximun Relaxum Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder is up-canyon from the Cow Skull boulder.

Routes.Name: Maximum Relaxum
Routes.Description: Begin low low down in the cave and climb out through the split on huge jugs, to smaller but good holds below the lip, then to the lip itself, and traverse right to top out.

Boulders.Name: Molly Boulder
Boulders.Description: Facing up-canyon is the clean solid wall of the Molly Boulder.

Routes.Name: Molly Dyno
Routes.Description: Use the two obvious good pockets around head height to make one huge move to the finishing jug of Molly.

Boulders.Name: China Doll Boulder
Boulders.Description: Left of the Molly boulder is a tall, highly featured wall.

Routes.Name: China Doll
Routes.Description: Climb the pretty and inviting rib feature on the boulder left of Molly, on huge holds.

Boulders.Name: Misery Cave
Boulders.Description: A room formed by the West face of the Misery boulder.

Routes.Name: The Black Stuff
Routes.Description: This is a tall and exciting problem on bomb-proof rock.

Boulders.Name: Flake Boulder
Boulders.Description: Above the Misery Cave and the Unclimbed Roof Crack, near the top of the slope is a large boulder with a fresh-cleaved chalk-colored slab on its uphill side and a dark brown north-facing side with a large left-facing flake crack.

Routes.Name: The Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the leftwards arching arete with poor feet and improving hands.

Routes.Name: The Groove
Routes.Description: Climb the groove directly via a series of excellent technical moves.

Boulders.Name: The Bird Cage Boulder
Boulders.Description: From the center canyon follow the path up the east slope from the Pow Pow Area. The boulder is easily recognized by the fang like feature towards its right side.

Routes.Name: The Fang
Routes.Description: Start at the large hole on the left of the cave. Move up and out towards the lip of the cave. Using core strength stay on and reach down and right to the fang. Grab the fang and squirm up it to reach better holds and the top.

Boulders.Name: The Passageway
Boulders.Description: Turn right on entering the Ice caves to enter this passageway leading to the back of the caves.

Routes.Name: The Mothership Connection
Routes.Description: Start at a huge hold on a block at head height. Climb via a horizontal crack to gain and climb the front face of the hanging boulder.

Boulders.Name: Prozac Nation Boulder
Boulders.Description: This set of bluffs contains a dense supply of fun moderates including Garden Pest and Prozac Nation.

Routes.Name: Prozac Nation
Routes.Description: Start below the large horizontal flake. Climb up the pocketed wall and reach left to gain the flake. From the flake make a big move to the pistol grip hold then another over the overhang.Finish on big holds straight up.

Boulders.Name: The Snapper Boulder
Boulders.Description: This line of cliffs/boulders has a prominent high buttress at its left.

Routes.Name: Fire Pit
Routes.Description: Climb up the arete with a big move to a good hold at mid height. Continue with a tricky pull to great finishing holds.

Boulders.Name: Rim Job Boulder
Boulders.Description: A tall narrow boulder situated just below the rim has two good problems on good rock. From the parking lot head up right towards the rim. You'll see the distinctive overhanging face on the right.

Routes.Name: Whiskey, Beer and Spliff Hits for Breakfast
Routes.Description: Start with hands low on good holds. Pull on get the feet set and crank out the steep face, finishing with a long reach up to the lip of the boulder.

Boulders.Name: Birthday Boulder
Boulders.Description: These boulders lie 20 feet from the upper parking area loop.

Routes.Name: Birthday Left
Routes.Description: Far left route on the North face, just left of Birthday Direct. Stand-start on obvious crimps and work your way up slightly left to the lip.

Routes.Name: Birthday Direct
Routes.Description: Stand-start matched on a crimp and make a reach up to a high right-hand gaston. Climb straight up with another gaston to a perfect jug on the lip.

Boulders.Name: The Prow Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder just east of the Birthday Boulder.

Routes.Name: The Prow
Routes.Description: Sit-start on a sidepull and an undercling. Climb straight up the blunt arete with juggy sidepulls and good flakes. Tha stand start is V1

Boulders.Name: The Loaf
Boulders.Description: A large loaf-like boulder with some fun highballs on the west face.

Routes.Name: The Rising
Routes.Description: Begin at opposing sidepulls and make a hard move to a crimp. Pull through to gain sidepulls and the top. A left start, using a large, but flexing hold is a little harder.

Boulders.Name: Hero Roof Boulder
Boulders.Description: From the Birthday Boulders parking area, walk east about 50 yards past the Pope's Hat Boulder and Boy and Girl Rocks until you reach the overhanging face on your right. The trail goes directly under 'Hero Roof'.

Routes.Name: Hero Roof
Routes.Description: Sit-start low on big patina edges on the right side of the overhanging face, then work your way up and left along the lip of the roof on good jugs. Pull over to a jug on the top.

Boulders.Name: Iron Man Boulder
Boulders.Description: Walk past the 'Hero Roof Boulder' and it'll be up on your left about 30 feet.

Routes.Name: Iron Man Traverse
Routes.Description: Climb the obvious rail from left to right until you can make a big move to a sloper over the lip.

Boulders.Name: Buttermilk Stem Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder is just uphill from the Rowell Rocks, a group of boulders that are west of the Cave Area.

Routes.Name: Buttermilk Stem
Routes.Description: Stand-start with wide palms and make a tricky first move to get your right foot on (crux). Stem your way up to the good fin and jugs to the easy but great top-out.

Routes.Name: Buttermilk Stem Sit Start
Routes.Description: Starts matched on the juggy undercling and just pull up and press into the V1.

Boulders.Name: Robinson's Rubber Tester Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder down hill from Soul Slinger.

Routes.Name: Robinson's Rubber Tester
Routes.Description: Climb the slab up the center.

Boulders.Name: Grandpa Peabody Boulder
Boulders.Description: The grandaddy of them all, and the most impressive boulder that most climbers will ever lay their eyes on.

Routes.Name: Advanced Rockcraft Arete
Routes.Description: For many, this is the perfect highball. Located on the iconic Grandpa Peabody Boulder, the physical crux is, for most, pulling onto Grandpa from a smaller boulder. The mental crux for many is the last pull over on to the top. After getting established on Grandpa, traverse right and then shoot up via immaculate crimps. Incredible!

Boulders.Name: Grandma Peabody Boulder
Boulders.Description: This monster block sits just uphill from the even bigger Gandpa Peabody.

Routes.Name: Essential Peabody
Routes.Description: Go more or less straight up many huecos to a hole and finish up the slab to the summit, or downclimb.

Boulders.Name: Green Hornet Boulder
Boulders.Description: A fine boulder with a nice steep slab on the north side. A couple hundred yards or so west of Dale's Dome in the trees.

Routes.Name: The Green Hornet
Routes.Description: Climb small but good edges straight up the black streak to a committing crux near the top.

Boulders.Name: Get Carter Boulder
Boulders.Description: A lone boulder west of the main area.

Routes.Name: Grommit
Routes.Description: Follow the right-trending line of sidepulls to a hard move reaching out right and shooting to the lip.

Routes.Name: To Kill Ya Corner
Routes.Description: Start high on the triangular block. Press out a technical high-step with a crimp to reach the large positive edge. Finish on jugs up high.
